DataElement.preferredName: Dynamic Positron Emission Tomography and Computed Tomography Scan Start Time
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The start time of the dynamic PET CT imaging scan.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Dynamic Scan Positron Emission Tomography and Computed Tomography Scan Begin
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Scan having a number of sequential frames._An imaging technique that utilizes positron emission tomography and computed tomography in a single machine._Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Dynamic Scan Positron Emission Tomography and Computed Tomography Scan
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Scan having a number of sequential frames.:An imaging technique that utilizes positron emission tomography and computed tomography in a single machine.

Concepts.definition: A scan having a number of sequential frames.

Concepts.longName: Positron Emission Tomography and Computed Tomography Scan
Concepts.definition: An imaging technique that utilizes positron emission tomography and computed tomography in a single machine.

Property.preferredDefinition: Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.

Concepts.definition: Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: Princess Margaret Cancer Centre, Toronto, ON

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ISO 8061 time recorded as hh:mm:ss based on a 24 hour clock.   Precision can be truncated by omitting the seconds or both the seconds and minutes (23:59 or 23).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Time is the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.  It may also refer to a specific point in this continuum or to the interval separating two points.  It is generally measured in minutes, days, months, or years.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

ValueDomain.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
